xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: This is a library module offering the same set of functions defined by Microsoft Excel.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:author: Sorin Nasoi

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Import excel-text module functions.
The day of the week, from a date.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: the day of the week as a number, where from 0 (Sunday) to 6 (Saturday).

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-datetime:day-of-week
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function excel-datetime:day-of-week($date as xs:anyAtomicType?) as xs:integer?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Tests if a year is leap or not.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: true if the year part of the supplied $date is a leap year, false otherwise.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-datetime:is-leap-year
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare %private function excel-datetime:is-leap-year($date as xs:date) as xs:boolean

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the number of days between two dates based on a 360-day year.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return:
The number of days between two dates based on a 360-day year (twelve 30-day months), which is used in some accounting calculations.
Use this function to help compute payments if your accounting system is based on twelve 30-day months.
The metod used is U.S. (NASD). If the starting date is the last day of a month, it becomes equal to the 30th of the same month.
If the ending date is the last day of a month and the starting date is earlier than the 30th of a month, the ending date becomes equal to the 1st of the next month; otherwise the ending date becomes equal to the 30th of the same month.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-datetime:days360
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-datetime:days360($start_date as xs:date, $end_date as xs:date) as xs:integer

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the number of days between two dates based on a 360-day year.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $method if false then US/NASD Method is used, otherwise the European Method is used.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return:
The number of days between two dates based on a 360-day year (twelve 30-day months), which is used in some accounting calculations. Use this function to help compute payments if your accounting system is based on twelve 30-day months.
The European Method (30E/360)
- If either date A or B falls on the 31st of the month, that date will be changed to the 30th;
- Where date B falls on the last day of February, the actual date B will be used.
The US/NASD Method (30US/360)
- If both date A and B fall on the last day of February, then date B will be changed to the 30th.
- If date A falls on the 31st of a month or last day of February, then date A will be changed to the 30th.
- If date A falls on the 30th of a month after applying (2) above and date B falls on the 31st of a month, then date B will be changed to the 30th.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-datetime:days360
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-datetime:days360($start_date as xs:date, $end_date as xs:date, $method as xs:boolean) as xs:integer

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the hour of a time value.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The hour of a time value. The hour is as an integer, ranging from 0 (12:00 A.M.) to 23 (11:00 P.M.).

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-datetime:hour
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-datetime:hour($time as xs:time) as xs:integer?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the minutes of a time value.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The minutes of a time value. The minute is given as an integer, ranging from 0 to 59.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-datetime:minute
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-datetime:minute($time as xs:time) as xs:integer?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the month of a $date.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: the month of a $date. The month is given as an integer, ranging from 1 (January) to 12 (December).

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-datetime:month
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-datetime:month($date as xs:date) as xs:integer?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the seconds of a $time value.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The seconds of a $time value. The second is given as an integer in the range 0 (zero) to 59.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-datetime:second
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-datetime:second($time as xs:time) as xs:decimal?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the day of a $date, represented by a serial number.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The day of a $date, represented by a serial number. The day is given as an integer ranging from 1 to 31.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-datetime:day
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-datetime:day($date as xs:date) as xs:integer?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the year corresponding to a date.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The year corresponding to a date.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-datetime:year
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-datetime:year($date as xs:date) as xs:integer?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the current date.
Returns the current date and time.
Constructs a date given the hours, months and days.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: A date given the hours, months and days

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-datetime:date
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-datetime:date($year as xs:integer, $month as xs:integer, $day as xs:integer) as xs:date?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Constructs a time given the hours, minutes and seconds.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: A time given the hours, minutes and seconds.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-datetime:time
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-datetime:time($hour as xs:integer, $minute as xs:integer, $second as xs:integer) as xs:time?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the day of the week corresponding to a $date.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The day of the week corresponding to a $date. The day is given as an integer, ranging from 1 (Sunday) to 7 (Saturday).

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-datetime:weekday
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-datetime:weekday($date as xs:date) as xs:integer?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the day of the week corresponding to a $date depending on $return_type.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $return_type 1 for Numbers 1 (Sunday) through 7 (Saturday). 2 for Numbers 1 (Monday) through 7 (Sunday). 3 for Numbers 0 (Monday) through 6 (Sunday).
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return: The day of the week corresponding to a $date depending on $return_type.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:error: excel-err:Value if $return_type is outside the range [1,3].

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-datetime:weekday
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-datetime:weekday($date as xs:date, $return_type as xs:integer) as xs:integer?

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the number of whole working days between $start_date and $end_date.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return:
The number of whole working days between start_date and end_date.
Working days exclude weekends and any dates identified in holidays.
Use NETWORKDAYS to calculate employee benefits that accrue based on the number of days worked during a specific term.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-datetime:networkdays
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-datetime:networkdays($start_date as xs:date, $end_date as xs:date) as xs:integer*

xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:description: Returns the number of whole working days between $start_date and $end_date.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:param: $holidays one or more dates to exclude from the working calendar, such as state and federal holidays and floating holidays.
xqdoc:comment.xqdoc:return:
The number of whole working days between start_date and end_date.
Working days exclude weekends and any dates identified in holidays.
Use NETWORKDAYS to calculate employee benefits that accrue based on the number of days worked during a specific term.

xqdoc:function.xqdoc:name: excel-datetime:networkdays
xqdoc:function.xqdoc:signature: declare function excel-datetime:networkdays($start_date as xs:date, $end_date as xs:date, $holidays as xs:date*) as xs:integer*
